intro: Cracca nicaraguensis, commonly known as the Nicaraguan cracca, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and understudied species.
